quest.name: Waiting in the Winglet
journal: Forgemaster Brithael has a special commission only you can handle.

The guild is busier than ever due to your numerous past efforts. Countless customers have requested you by name, but Brithael has only seen fit to oblige a single one. Speak with Faezahr to learn the details of this special commission.

A former champion of the Coliseum has come all the way from Gridania to speak with you in person. You will find the client waiting for you on the platform just below the Drowning Wench, where you may speak in private.

The client, who chose not to divulge her name, wishes to furnish a struggling gladiator with a weapon that befits his skill and experience. This gladiator, known as the Bronze Bull, is apparently another former champion who has chosen to fight under a different name. You are to craft a quality cobalt winglet, meld to it a savage might materia of the third grade, and deliver the finished product to Faezahr.

Upon confirming that your sword satisfies the client's requirements, Faezahr summons the Bronze Bull to collect the weapon in person, while the anonymous client surreptitiously listens. The gladiator is at first puzzled by the gesture, unable to understand the motives of your patron. However, when Faezahr delivers a cryptic message, the Bronze Bull immediately identifies your client as the Hellfire Phoenix, who he thought had perished in the Calamity years ago. He accepts the sword, proclaiming that he will one day stand atop the Coliseum and do it justice, and leaves without meeting your client. Speak with her and see if these events transpired as she desired.

Your client explains that her desire to remain distant from the Coliseum and its affairs drove her to deliver the sword in this manner. Nevertheless, she could not resist using Greinfarr's words to reveal her identity to the former champion. Having entrusted your payment to the forgemaster, she bids you return to him to receive it.

Brithael reflects on how you single-handedly changed the guild's fortunes, stating that the impact of your deeds will be felt for years to come. With a glint in his eye and a smile on his face, he calls you one of the best blacksmiths he has ever known.

※The next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Deliver a cobalt winglet melded with a savage might materia III to Faezahr.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Good news, Forename! That gladiator ye outfitted, Muriel? Done the work of a million merchants fer us since! Her name's on the lips of every Coliseum fan, as is the name o' the smitty what forged her armaments!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Our wares're sellin' faster than we can forge 'em, an' every member o' the guild is reapin' the benefits! Aye, the ale'll flow like wine at the Wench tonight!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: O' course, customers, they've been askin' for ye by name, but I tell 'em ye ain't got the time to personally craft all their butcher's knives an' bric-a-brac. I've certainly no intention o' shovelin' that drudgery off on ye.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: But there's one commission what requires yer personal attention, I reckon. This one comes to us by way o' Faezahr, so pay the man a visit.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Before ye go, a word o' warnin': Faezahr's a solemn soul to begin with, but this job's got him wound tighter than ever, judgin' from his countenance. Best be prepared fer a bleedin' tough challenge.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: There you are! Hear me, Forename─none other than the finest blacksmith in all Vylbrand will do for this task.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: So renowned are your weapons that your name echoes through the distant wood of Gridania. So powerful your forge that it has bent their disdain for steel into admiration.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: As such, a former champion of the Coliseum living amid the leaves has contacted me in hopes of engaging your services.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: That is all I can say. The rest she would tell you herself.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: The client wishes to meet with you in private, and will be waiting for you on the platform just below the Drowning Wench. Pray do not keep her waiting.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: An honor, Forename Surname. I appreciate you coming all this way to meet with me.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: I am told you are a blacksmith without peer. It is for this reason that I have come to seek your assistance.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: The sword I would have you forge must befit a storied Coliseum champion─rather, a man who would become one once more.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: This gladiator is recently returned to Ul'dah, and has chosen to fight under a different name, you see.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Perhaps you are familiar with the Bronze Bull? I thought not. His performance on the bloodsands has been less than stellar.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Despite his wealth of experience, he struggles. I have seen him fight; his weapons are his weakness. But I fear he thinks himself at fault.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Which brings me to my request: I wish to arm the Bronze Bull with a quality cobalt winglet, strengthened with a savage might materia of the third grade.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: He is a far greater gladiator than his record suggests, and deserves better than the rubbish he wields.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: When the sword is ready, deliver it to Faezahr. He shall see that the Bronze Bull receives it.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I am aware of the client's specifications. As soon as I verify that your sword is to her satisfaction, I shall contact the intended recipient.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: You have outdone yourself yet again. Your task is almost complete.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: In a most peculiar request, the client wishes to be on hand, yet out of sight, for the purveyance of her gift.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I shall attend to the arrangements. You need only be ready.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Since when have you taken a fancy to a male gladiator, Faezahr? What's all this really about?

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I assure you, you will not be displeased. Quite the opposite, I should hope.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Pleased, then?

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Precisely. We come bearing a gift.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: A gift? For me? Hah! Give it to someone who deserves it. I'm in no mood to be fawned over.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Due to your mounting defeats, no doubt.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: I know my record, merchant.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Ah, but that is the very reason I believe this gift will lift your spirits. Behold the cure for your recent woes─a sword like no other!

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: This blade, I've...I've never seen its equal. Did you forge this, smith?

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: I would be proud to call it my own.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I believe that is precisely what our patron intended.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Care to tell me who your patron is? And why he sees fit to confer upon me such a treasure?

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: I can say only that she prays for your success. It is her hope that with this sword you will win new glory, and that these words will help you to remember that of old:

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: “The way of the sword is such that all who walk it become lost.”

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: ...Her words, eh?

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Well, I don't see why she had to orchestrate this mummer's farce. I would've gladly accepted the sword from her in person.

dialogue.name: FAEZAHL
dialogue.text: Oh?

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Aye. I thought the Calamity had claimed her life.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: Heh, I should've known better than to think the Hellfire Phoenix would die so easily.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: And now it is my turn to take wing.

dialogue.name: GREINFARR
dialogue.text: On my honor, I shall one day stand atop the Coliseum, and do this sword justice.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Greinfarr's no fool. I suspect he knew I was present the moment his words left Faezahr's lips.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Hm? Why not give him the sword in person? It is...complicated.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: Simply put, I will not involve myself directly in Coliseum affairs. Long ago, I swore never again to take up sword or spear for sport.

dialogue.name: JMOLDVA
dialogue.text: I have entrusted the forgemaster with your honorarium. Please accept it with my heartfelt thanks.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Well, look who's back from bringin' in another fortune!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: I don't know how ye do it, Forename, but I'm glad yer doin' it fer us.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: If ye hadn't come along when ye did an' helped us turn things around with yer quality smithin', I reckon I'd be another workless drunk drownin' me sorrows at the Wench.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Instead, I'm a happily employed drunk celebratin' me successes at the Wench!

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Ye know, any lout with a tool can put passion into herhis work, but to have it come out the other side an' affect folk is true artistry.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: An' make no mistake, lasslad: the impact of what ye've done fer the guild will be felt fer years to come.

dialogue.name: BRITHAEL
dialogue.text: Yer one o' the best godsdamned smitties I've had the pleasure o' knowin', Forename. There ain't nothin' more to say than that.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the blacksmith quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next blacksmith quest will be available from Brithael.
